title: Do rural populations experience greater worry and fatalism about cancer?

title_detail.value: Do rural populations experience greater worry and fatalism about cancer?

summary: People living in rural areas are more likely to have ambiguous beliefs and fears about getting cancer, as well as more fatalistic viewpoints than urban dwellers, reports a research team.

summary_detail.value: People living in rural areas are more likely to have ambiguous beliefs and fears about getting cancer, as well as more fatalistic viewpoints than urban dwellers, reports a research team.
